text: Try King's Field IV: The Ancient City for PS2. It's got the most haunting soundtrack and visuals I have ever experienced in a game. Plus, even though the combat system is still clunky and the graphics pretty basic, it's miles ahead of the older King's Field games.

author: FlameG102

text: @sinituuke Yeah, L.O.I rocked. Curse of Darkness was good, too. Little bit deeper in terms of the RPG elements. If you haven't picked it up, you should. Also, if you liked the combat, you should check out Devil May Cry 3 (if you haven't already). It's ridiculously hard, but equally as awesome. Great music, good story and spectacular combat :)

author: sinituuke

text: I've been playing turn-based games my entire life, and decided I need to broaden my horizons a little, still staying on the RPG grounds. First I tried Kingdom Hearts. I was very bad at it, which discouraged me greatly. Then I got Lament of Innocence. I was amazed by its smoothness from the very start and how enjoyable it got as I advanced, and how little practice it required even from a clumsy beginner like me. Cutscenes were kind of silly, though, but music was sheer dynamite.
author: sinituuke

text:
What would you call that repetitive, distant echoing sound in the background during0:27-1:38?
